result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree C Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 8:15am [ma]
Defendant Desiree C Smith in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
--Atty. Olsen indicates that he has spoke with the guardian of the victim, and that the guardian did wish to be present for the hearing today, but unavailable; leaves to the Court whether the Court is precluded from proceeding today
--ADA Shock recites note left in file re: phone call with guardian of victim
--The Court questions Atty. Olsen as to his conversation with guardian of victim and position on the rights of the victim
--The Court cannot find that in fact Mr. Bergdoll as the victim has been in any way to trying to make up a decision about what to do or that he had made a decision to not be heard vs. appear in Court and be heard.
--The Court determines that a guardian may speak on behalf of a victim as to the wishes of ward/ advocate as to what believes is in best interest of ward
--The Court concludes that no constitutional right is absolute, further states that if so every sentencing hearing could be adjourned by the victim.

--ADA Shock notes that the guardian of the victim's call to the DA's office yesterday was prompted by Atty. Olsen's call to him.

ADA Shock indicates it is the State's position to proceed to sentencing today

The Court notes that at no time did the guardian convey that he wished to attend to convey the wishes of the victim; further that written was submitted with the signature of victim

ADA Shock again verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Olsen provides the Court with receipt proving payment of restitution less $11.04, which will be paid today at the COC office

The Court finds that in contacting the victim/ guardian of the victim Atty. Olsen was attempting to have a breach of the plea agreement

Statement made by Ms. Smith
The Court questions Ms. Smith

On Counts #1,#2, #3, #4: the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber/work release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--random drug screening
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment,or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/ maintain employment as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to submit DNA sample


The Court orders separate from Probation that the remaining resitution be paid, further that is will be satisfied today.


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 9:03am
Sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 08:10 am.
with Elements and Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 2:11pm [mo]
Defendant Desiree C Smith in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea will be entered today, parties have agreed that sentencing will occur on a later date to allow production of proof a restitution payment

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4 of the Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the remaining counts are read in and dismissed.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

recess: 2:24pm

Case called at 8:53am [mo]
Defendant Desiree C Smith in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Ms. Smith waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess: 9:00am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/11/16 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 6/28/16 at 1:45pm
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:09 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing)
Defendant Desiree C Smith in court with Attorney Daniel E. Olsen, who appears by telephone. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall confirms victim rights compliance, court so finds
Atty Olsen informs the Court that he does not appear, as had a Court appearance in Arapaho County, Colorado on Friday, met with clients over the weekend and was unable to fly out Sunday as anticipated, due to secutiry issues. Requests the Court allow appearance by telephone or adjourn the matter. Did speak with ADA Teuber this morning to inform her that Miss Smith will be waiving her preliminary hearing and continuing with case. 
Miss Smith informs the Court that she does wish to waive her preliminary hearing

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent - Miss Smith informs the Court that she does not wish to waiver her preliminary hearing
Atty Olsen has discussion with Miss Smith regarding waiver; she informs the Court that she does wish to waive her preliminary hearing
Upon questioning of the Court, Miss Smith indicates that she has not consumed any alcohol or drugs prior to today's hearing, but is nervous and confused without Atty Olsen here  
Court informs parties that It can not take a waiver of preliminary hearing due to Miss Smith's comments today and will reschedule preliminary hearing
off-record for scheduling: 9:18 - 9:19 am 
Clerk announces date for the record
Recess: 9:19 am 

NEXT: (1) Reschedule Preliminary Hearing 4/18/16 at 9:00 am  - Send notices
Preliminary hearing at 04-04-2016 09:00 am

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 3:27pm. 
Defendant Desiree C Smith in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Smith withdraws her previous written request to adjourn the Initial Appearance. 
Ms. Smith verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Ms. Smith verifies that she heard the Court give information on her right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.
After Ms. Smith indicates that she intends to seek counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Melvin Bergdoll or with Brian Zubke
--no possession or use of any financial cards or documents issued in any other person's name
recess 3:38pm. 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/6/15 at 2:00pm.
